developmental_risk_block.text: Developmental risk is flagged due to limited adolescent data and uncertain long-term effects. Endocrine, growth, neurodevelopmental, and metabolic setpoints may be sensitive to perturbation. This section is descriptive only; uncertainty is explicitly acknowledged.

interaction_summary.text: Interactions here are category flags — they’re meant to help you ask better questions and avoid obvious conflicts. They are not a dosing guide.
interaction_summary.title: Interaction summary

interaction_summary.text: If you’re on cardiovascular, anticoagulant/antiplatelet, serotonergic, or immunomodulating meds/supplements, treat uncertainty as a reason to slow down and verify with a clinician.

changelog.summary: Initial canonical entry for Atrial Natriuretic Peptide
changelog.detail: Generated from queue ingestion (Phase 6). Requires human-authored, evidence-bounded content.

practical.bottom_line: Atrial natriuretic peptide (ANP) is a cardiovascular hormone involved in fluid balance and blood pressure regulation. It is not a wellness peptide; non-medical use can cause unsafe drops in blood pressure and electrolyte shifts.
benefits: physiology relevance for vascular tone and natriuresis
clinical and research relevance in cardiovascular regulation
side_effects_serious: dangerous low blood pressure symptoms (confusion, collapse)
signs of electrolyte imbalance (severe weakness, palpitations)
who_should_be_cautious: people with low blood pressure or on blood pressure medications
people with kidney disease or electrolyte disorders
adolescents (high consequence plus limited context for use)
